snippet: In a case that has drawn national attention, lawyers have been arguing over whether California’s laws on teacher tenure, firing and layoffs violate students’ constitutional right to an education.
abstract: Lawyers have been arguing for more than two months over whether California’s laws on teacher tenure, firing and layoffs violate students’ constitutional right to an education; by July, Los Angeles County Superior Court Judge Rolf Treu will deliver first legal ruling on case, which has attracted national attention.
lead_paragraph: In a case that has drawn national attention, lawyers have been arguing over whether California’s laws on teacher tenure, firing and layoffs violate students’ constitutional right to an education.

headline.main: Competing Views of Teacher Tenure Are on Display in California Case
headline.print_headline: Battle Between 2 Views of Teacher Tenure
